alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 2:41PM EDT until July 13 at 8:50PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Northampton. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 112.0 feet, Lowland flooding is expected in and around Northampton including low lying sections of the Oxbow. Minor flooding affects Hadley along Aqua Vitae Road. In Hatfield, flooding is expected in the lowest lying sections, primarily farming interests outside flood dike protection. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 112.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 112.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM EDT Thursday was 114.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 111.7 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 112.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 112.1 feet on 04/26/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EDT.
